data.title: Historic Downtown Pocatello
data.meta_description: Discover the wide variety of exciting events in Historic Downtown Pocatello. Contact our head office for details.
data.text:
WE LOVE EVENTS! There are a variety of events that take place throughout the year in Historic Downtown Pocatello!

Below is our Events Calendar and a description of our signature events. Downtown businesses and merchants host

a variety of events as well. For a complete list of all the events in the area, please be sure to check out

our Facebook page for updates on current and upcoming events.

First Friday Art Walk

Every First Friday of the Month

5:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m.

Locations throughout Historic Downtown Pocatello

Historic Downtown Pocatello is the place to be on the first Friday of every month. First Friday Art Walk features art, music, food, fashion and

more in over 20 downtown shops and restaurants. Admission and parking for this event are free.

From 5pm to 8pm on the first Friday of every month you are invited to come enjoy Art Walk in Historic Downtown Pocatello.

2024 First Friday Art Walk Dates:

January 5 July 5

February 2 August 2

March 1 September 6

April 5 October 4

May 3 November 1

June 7 December 6

Portneuf Valley Farmers Market 2024

Every Saturday starting May 4th through October 26th

Wednesday's Farmers Market opens June 5th to August 28th

Located at Lookout Point

The Portneuf Valley Farmers Market was established in 1990 and has grown to include over 100 different

vendors. The market is open from 9:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. starting in May and running through the last Saturday in October.

The market is also open on Wednesdays from 5:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m. beginning in June through the end of August.

For information about how to become a vendor, special events, or what's at the market this week, please visit the market's web site: www.pvfm.info

The Market Manager is Ellen Loomis and she can be reached at 208-705-7333 or via email at manager@portneufvalleyfarmersmarket.com

Welcome Back Orange & Black

Monday, August 19th

4:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m.

Idaho State University students will once again have the opportunity to meet community businesses, win prizes, enjoy free giveaways, music and a variety of booths and entertainment during the 14th annual “Welcome Back Orange and Black” from 4:00 to 7:00 p.m. on Monday, August 19 in Historic Downtown Pocatello.

Vendor Registration is now open for this year's Welcome Back Orange & Black event on August 19th!

Kind Community Week Kick-Off Event

Monday, September 16th

4:00p.m. to 7:00 p.m.

Located at Lookout Point

Kind Community will be hosting the Kind Week 2024 Kick-Off Celebration on Monday, September 16

at Lookout Point. From 4:00-8:00 p.m. there will be live music, live performances, the Exhibition in Kind

featuring local vendors, Kind activities, the Pocatello Food Truck Round Up and more!

Gate City Brewfest 2 - OKTOBERFEST

Saturday, September 28th

3:00 p.m. - 8:00 p.m.

Lookout Point

Tickets are now available for this year’s Gate City Brewfest 2 – OKTOBERFEST, coming to Historic Downtown Pocatello on Saturday, September 28 at Lookout Point. From 3-8:00 p.m., sample German style beers and craft beers from our local, regional and national brewers. There will be German Style food by The Yellowstone Restaurant and The Sandtrap! Idaho Rovers will be performing live on stage from 3-5:00 p.m. followed by The Kyd-J Band performing from 5-8:00 p.m. Tickets that include unlimited pours are $30 in advance or $35 at the door. Visit www.gatecitybrewfest.com for details.

Downtown's Great Pumpkin Fest

Saturday, October 5th

9:00 a.m. - 2:00 p.m.

The Great Pumpkin Fest returns to Historic Downtown Pocatello on Saturday October 5, along with the Portneuf Valley Farmers Market Harvest Festival.

From 9:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. enjoy a beautiful Fall Saturday strolling through the festivities and

visiting our local shops, coffee stops, bakeries, restaurants and breweries. Come Join Us!

Haunted History Walking Tours 2024

October 5, 11, 12, 18, 19, 25 and 26th

Our favorite paranormal investigators are back! SPIRO Paranormal and Historic Downtown Pocatello are pleased to present the 16th Annual Haunted History Walking Tours on Friday & Saturday evenings in October. Visit four haunted buildings in Historic Downtown Pocatello, not just walk by them,

but go inside to learn more about the history of the building and experience for yourself the charm and haunts inside!

Tickets will go on sale in August 2024.

Trick-or-Treat Downtown

Thursday, October 31st, 2024

Trick-or-Treat Downtown will take place on Thursday, October 31, Halloween afternoon, from 3:00-5:30 p.m. Our merchants and businesses will have treats for all of the little ghosts and goblins! Come in costume and walk business to business enjoying a safe, daytime Halloween event.

Lookout Credit Union Presents Historic Downtown Pocatello’s Annual Christmas Night Lights Parade!

Friday, November 29th

Parade Begins Moving at 6:30pm

2024 Theme: "Lookout For Santa's Reindeer & Friends!"

A community tradition returns as the Christmas Night Lights parade begins winding its way through Downtown Pocatello on Friday, November 29th, at 6:30pm. Santa will ride atop of the City of Pocatello’s Fire Truck at the end of the parade officially welcoming the Christmas Season.

Parade Registration is now open! Please review the Parade Instructions below, then complete the On-Line Registration Form.

**Be sure to click on the "Send Registration Form" button after completing the form. We will not receive your information if you miss this step.**

If you prefer to register via US Mail or in person, please print and complete the Paper Registration Form located below the Parade Instructions

and return to Historic Downtown Pocatello, PO Box 222, Pocatello ID 83204 or at 435 W. Center St.

Idaho Bridal Fair 2025

Saturday March 1, 2025

Located at the Red Lion Hotel

1555 Pocatello Creek Rd.

Molinelli’s Jewelers will present the 2025 Idaho Bridal Fair on Saturday, March 1. If you are newly engaged or have a wedding coming up, be sure to register for the show at www.idahobridalfair.com. Admission is free and the show will be open from 9:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. at the Red Lion Hotel Pocatello. There will be live demonstrations throughout the event. At 11:00 a.m. enjoy an elegant fashion show presented by Valentine Ballroom & Bridal. Over 30 vendors will be on site featuring everything an engaged couple needs to plan the perfect wedding and future.

Saturday March 8, 2025

1:00 p.m. - 6:00 p.m.

Locations throughout Downtown Pocatello

The 14th Annual Gate City Brewfest will be returning to Pocatello on Saturday, March 8, 2025. From 1:00 to 6:00 p.m. brewers will offer over 80 different beers for tasting in restaurants, breweries, pubs and bars throughout Downtown Pocatello. Sample craft beers new to our area plus local and regional favorites.

Tickets will go on sale in December 2024.

Downtown Easter Egg Fest

Saturday, April 12, 2025

Eggs at 11:00 a.m. until gone.

Pictures with the Easter Bunny 11:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.

The Easter Egg Fest is coming to Historic Downtown Pocatello on Saturday, April 12, 2025. Participating merchants will have filled

Easter Eggs for the kids beginning at 11:00 a.m. until all of the eggs are gone. There will be thousands of eggs for the kids and

plenty of time for families to walk through our beautiful shops and restaurants.

Oldies Rod & Custom Car Show

Saturday, June 14, 2025

9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

100 Block S. Union Pacific Avenue

The Pocatello Senior Activity Center and Historic Downtown Pocatello present the annual Oldies Rod & Custom Car Show. This year's show will be held on the grassy area on the 100 block of S. Union Pacific Avenue, behind Station Square. There will be a variety of vehicles, each with its own story and history. There will be oldies music, food and family fun. This event is a fundraiser for the Pocatello Senior Activity Center. Please plan to join us! To register your vehicle, please contact the Senior Activity Center at 208-233-1212.

There is Always Something Happening in Downtown!

Our staff and Promotions & Events Committee are continuously working to bring additional events to Downtown. If you have an upcoming event planned in Downtown or an event you would like to bring to Pocatello, please contact the Historic Downtown Pocatello office. Our contact information appears below.

Our events would not be possible without the generous help and support of many community volunteers, supporters and friends!
